channel.title: Splits. Am I right/forgetting anything?
channel.description:
So yesterday I got bored, and I was like well all the cool kids are using String.split for their codes. So I Googled it, and I went to Java's site. Man was I excited! I learned that a String.split actually SPLITS THE STRING! So I was like well this is shit, and got writing.
[code]String str = {"I can't stand Google"}; String[] str2 = str.split(" ");[/code]
Right? str2[0] = I str2[1] = can't str2[2] = stand str2[3] = Google
Correct?
Am I right and am I missing anything/is there a better way for this to be written?

item.title: Splits. Am I right/forgetting anything?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

why couldnt you just try it out before asking here?

edit: why is the string surrounded by {}…

Read full topic

item.title: Splits. Am I right/forgetting anything?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:6, topic:288409”]read the javadocs, yo

ps, t4 the string you split with is a regex[/quote]
Oh… that’s right; I am an idiot. I was thinking of java.util.regex.Pattern… :\

Read full topic

item.title: Splits. Am I right/forgetting anything?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote="™, post:4, topic:288409"][quote author=T4 link=topic=381294.msg2865300#msg2865300 date=1247436042]

You did it right. Im not sure if there’s a better way though.

Possibly regex if you were looking for a complex pattern. In this case, no.
[/quote]

Thanks. Could you possibly explain a little bit, or give me key searching words, T4_?[/quote]
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/essential/regex/literals.html

Read full topic

item.title: Splits. Am I right/forgetting anything?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

So yesterday I got bored, and I was like well all the cool kids are using String.split for their codes. So I Googled it, and I went to Java’s site. Man was I excited! I learned that a String.split actually SPLITS THE STRING! So I was like well this is shit, and got writing.

String str = {"I can't stand Google"}; String[] str2 = str.split(" ");

Right?
str2[0] = I
str2[1] = can’t
str2[2] = stand
str2[3] = Google

Correct?

Am I right and am I missing anything/is there a better way for this to be written?
